item.title: [PI] My skills are my worst Enemy
item.dc:creator: @Virgin Virgin
item.description:
@Virgin wrote:

Mine doesn't give that. But Yes, that does help.
_____________________________________________________________________
Okay Okay Okay, I was messing with my skills and FireMaking was one of my biggest problems for ah few reasons.
It gives 2m cash each log I burn.... -.-
I can NoClip though anything with it.
And, I set the firemaking in Config to 1;
[code]	public static final int FIREMAKING_EXPERIENCE = 1;[/code]
and I burned ONE normal log on the server and got, 1511 exp and 2m coins........
Now nothing in my Firemaking class says anything about giving two mill or multiplying 1511 but config class... -.-
Could someone please help me?

Mine doesn’t give that. But Yes, that does help.

Okay Okay Okay, I was messing with my skills and FireMaking was one of my biggest problems for ah few reasons.
It gives 2m cash each log I burn… -.-
I can NoClip though anything with it.
And, I set the firemaking in Config to 1;

and I burned ONE normal log on the server and got, 1511 exp and 2m coins…
Now nothing in my Firemaking class says anything about giving two mill or multiplying 1511 but config class… -.-
Could someone please help me?

item.source: [PI] My skills are my worst Enemy

item.title: [PI] My skills are my worst Enemy
item.dc:creator: @K0y K0y
item.description:
@K0y wrote:

Your config is calculating the experience off three different variables for your skills:
The skill string in config itself, i.e. WOODCUTTING XP:
The given xp advocated by the skill class (woodcutting.java)
And the final XP int, which in your case is one.
It multiples those given numbers to calculate individual experience values…
Hope this helps

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] My skills are my worst Enemy
item.dc:creator: @Virgin Virgin
item.description:
@Virgin wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:6, topic:460176”]The XP rates in Config.java are just multipliers. Thats why you see in your skill classes something like c.playerExperience = 800 * Config.WOODCUTTING_XP;[/quote]So wooow, lets say my WC xp in Config is 10, and it’s 10 in my woodcutting class too.
Does that mean its 100xp per log?

item.title: [PI] My skills are my worst Enemy
item.dc:creator: @Virgin Virgin
item.description:
@Virgin wrote:

I’m sorry guys, I posted this in a sleep daze. I’ve been working on trying to fix my skills all day, I event went as far as downloading new sources and trying to figure out the problem. But I just cannot seem to figure it out.
Yes, my skills are all over the place. Like, I don’t even know where to begin… I searched though my Config.java file and everything, I searched though Client.java and all my skills files… I just absolutely do not understand why it keeps doing what its doing…
You see the config.java I posted, thats what I want my skills to be for each log you cut, ore you mine, rune you craft, gem you craft, stall you thieve from, etc… Could somebody please help me?

Come on… Somebody…?

I learn best from Visuals, I have TeamViewer.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] My skills are my worst Enemy
item.dc:creator: @Virgin Virgin
item.description:
@Virgin wrote:

[code] /**
* Skill Experience Multipliers
*/
public static final int WOODCUTTING_EXPERIENCE = 30;
public static final int MINING_EXPERIENCE = 15;
public static final int SMITHING_EXPERIENCE = 50;
public static final int FARMING_EXPERIENCE = 20;
public static final int FIREMAKING_EXPERIENCE = 20;
public static final int HERBLORE_EXPERIENCE = 15;
public static final int FISHING_EXPERIENCE = 15;
public static final int AGILITY_EXPERIENCE = 25;
public static final int PRAYER_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int RUNECRAFTING_EXPERIENCE = 5;
public static final int CRAFTING_EXPERIENCE = 35;
public static final int THIEVING_EXPERIENCE = 22;
public static final int SLAYER_EXPERIENCE = 50;
public static final int COOKING_EXPERIENCE = 20;
public static final int FLETCHING_EXPERIENCE = 25;

public static final int XP_RATE = 1;

}
[/code]
